page.title: 05WILDLIFE, ST.BREWARD AREA. 4
page.content: { ROOK THIS BIRD LIVES IN LARGE GROUPS AT THE TOPS OF TREES. THE NEST IS A PLATFORM OF TWIGS. IT LAYS 4 TO 5 EGGS WHICH SHE INCUBATES ALONE FOR 18 DAYS. THE DIET CONTAINS COCKCHAFFERS,{A KIND OF {CORNISH INSECT,}AND OTHER HARMFUL INSECTS INCLUDING SEEDS. TOWARDS THE WINTER THEY FLY SOUTH IN LARGE FLOCKS. {LENGTH: 46 CMS. {BARN OWL THE BARN OWL IS A SECRETIVE BIRD THAT HUNTS BY NIGHT LIKE OTHER OWLS. THIS SANDY COLOURED BIRD NESTS IN CHURCH STEEPLES AND OTHER DARK QUIET CORNERS. THE EGGS ARE OFTEN LAID IN A BARE SCRAPE AND ARE 4 TO 6 IN NUMBER AND WHITE IN COLOUR. THE DIET CONSISTS OF RODENTS, SPARROWS, AMPHIBIANS AND INSECTS. { {LENGTH: 34 CMS
